page.title: 08CARDROSS _ CLUBS
page.content: {VENUE-}MOST CLUBS MEET IN THE GEILSTON HALL. FORMERLY RUN BY THE GEILSTON TRUST, IT IS IN THE PROCESS OF BEING TRANSFERRED TO THE CARDROSS COMMUNITY COUNCIL. {SCOTTISH WOMENS RURAL INSTITUTE-} CARDROSS RURAL, FOUNDED IN 1922, WAS THE FIRST IN DUNBARTONSHIRE. IT HAS ABOUT 80 MEMBERS WHO MEET ONCE A MONTH. SUBSCRIPTION Â£3. {GUIDES AND BROWNIES-}THE GUIDES MEET ON A WEDNESDAY AND THE BROWNIES ON TUESDAYS AND THURSDAYS. ALTOGETHER OVER 70 GIRLS ARE INVOLVED. {CIVIL SERVICE CLUB-}A MONDAY AFTERNOON ONCE A FORTNIGHT IS THE TIME WHEN LOCAL RETIRED CIVIL SERVANTS MEET HERE. {BADMINTON, COUNTRY DANCING AND DOG {TRAINING CLUBS}ALSO MEET HERE.
